newsitem.title: USA: U.S West Coast crude jump Friday with higher NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: U.S West Coast crude jump Friday with higher NYMEX.

text.p: U.S. West Coast crude oil prices jumped in quiet Friday trade, pulled higher by NYMEX futures gains, players said.
NYMEX August crude rose 37 cents a barrel, while cash crude rose 51 cents a barrel to around $19.42.
West Coast trade was razor-thin Monday as traders planned how to move crude supplies and seattle their account books.
The price for Alaskan North Slope (ANS) crude, the regional benchmark, remained unchanged at $2.16 under July West Texas Intermediate/Cushing (WTI) crude.
Line 63 barrels also rose with NYMEX and cash West Texas Intermediate crude markets. California heavy Kern River grade edged up after Texaco raised posted prices late Thursday.
